title: JPMorgan Chase: A Case That Demonstrates Its Strong Risk-Management Culture
text: JPMorgan Chase has been subpoenaed for documents relating to its sale of preferred shares in Diamond Sports to Sinclair Broadcasting Company. Diamond Sports has since filed for bankruptcy, and the sale may be declared illegal by the court. Investors should not be alarmed, however. The assets were guaranteed by Sinclair, so it, not Morgan, would be liable for restitution for any illegal preferential transfers.

Citigroup saw a decline year-over-year in its Return on Tangible Common Equity as it continues to restructure and build up a stronger economic base.

title: JPMorgan Chase Shows Why It's the Best-Run Bank in the U.S.
text: JPMorgan Chase beat analysts' second-quarter earnings estimates. The bank benefited from higher interest rates and a gain on its purchase of First Republic Bank.

title: Growth And Earnings Recovery, Probable Fed Pivot And High Quality Stocks With Victor Dergunov
text: Victor Dergunov runs The Financial Prophet and today talks Q2 earnings, Fed's probable pivot, inflation, and high quality stocks. Continue to buy high quality companies on pullbacks and why Victor believes in Tesla.

title: Investors Heavily Search JPMorgan Chase & Co. (JPM): Here is What You Need to Know
text: Zacks.com users have recently been watching JPMorgan Chase & Co. (JPM) quite a bit. Thus, it is worth knowing the facts that could determine the stock's prospects.

title: U.S. banks shares spark after interest income boost, but outlook mixed
text: Big U.S. banks on Tuesday said higher interest rates had helped boost profits in the second quarter, causing shares to spike, but a pullback in consumer spending, slower loan growth and increased deposit costs may cloud the outlook for the sector.

title: 4 Best Stocks With More Upside as Dow Reaches 2023 High
text: Salesforce (CRM), Intel (INTC), JPMorgan (JPM) and McDonald's (MCD) in the Dow Jones index gain in double digits so far this year with more upside potential.

title: Bank ETFs bounce, with this fund heading for potentially best month since 2021
text: Exchange-traded funds that buy bank stocks were jumping Tuesday as investors assessed Wall Street's latest batch of second-quarter earnings results from giants including Bank of America and Morgan Stanley.

title: 3 Defensive Stocks to Shield Your Portfolio from this Market Volatility
text: Market volatility persists even as the stock market is up on the year. Both economic data and central bankers' commentary about the direction of interest rates continue to cause gyrations in equity markets.

title: Wall Street Analysts Think JPMorgan Chase & Co. (JPM) Is a Good Investment: Is It?
text: Investors often turn to recommendations made by Wall Street analysts before making a Buy, Sell, or Hold decision about a stock. While media reports about rating changes by these brokerage-firm employed (or sell-side) analysts often affect a stock's price, do they really matter?

title: Tesla to hand over Musk's emails to JPMorgan in lawsuit over 2018 tweet
text: JPMorgan Chase will get to review some of Elon Musk's emails as it pursues a lawsuit against Tesla over a bond contract dispute that arose after Musk tweeted he might take his electric car company private.

title: JPMorgan Chase stock rallies toward its longest win streak in 9 years
text: Shares of JPMorgan Chase & Co. JPM, +0.81% gained 0.8% in afternoon trading Wednesday, to put it on track for a ninth-straight gain. That would be the longest win streak for the banking giant's stock since the 10-day streak that ended Feb. 18, 2014.

title: Investors cheer Wall Street's green shoots as bank executives stay cautious
text: U.S. banking giants reported lackluster results for investment banking in the second quarter, but that has not stopped investors from buying their stocks as a bet on revived dealmaking.

title: Bank Stocks' Q2 Earnings Show Consumer & Corporate Tug-of-War
text: Resilient consumers but a cautious corporate behavior pulled the strings on banking earnings in the second quarter.

title: FedNow launches today. What to know about the Fed's real-time payment service.
text: The Federal Reserve officially launched its FedNow service Thursday, plunging into the world of real-time payments.

title: JPMorgan Chase stock headed for longest winning streak since 2014
text: JPMorgan Chase & Co. JPM, +1.49% stock is up 1.4% on Thursday for its 10th consecutive day in positive territory. If the gains hold until the end of the session, JPMorgan Chase stock is poised for its longest winning streak since Feb. 18, 2014, when it rose for 10 trading days in a row, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

title: My Top 10 Dividend Growth Stocks To Invest In For July 2023
text: In today's article, I will introduce you to 10 dividend growth companies that I believe are attractive to invest in right now. The 10 selected picks have shown an Average Dividend Growth Rate [CAGR] of 22.27% over the past 5 years. The Average P/E [FWD] Ratio of the selected picks stands at 21.52, which is attractive in my opinion due to the companies' growth perspectives.

title: US banks' second quarter earnings: the results in charts
text: U.S. banks benefited from higher interest rates in the second-quarter, driving a rally in major indexes, but lower consumer spending, slower loan growth and the increased costs of retaining deposits cloud the outlook for the sector.

title: Stocks in Focus on Dow Jones ETF's First 9-Day Run Since 2017
text: Since last week, the Dow Jones index has been performing very well. The index jumped more than 150 points yesterday to log its first nine-day rally since 2017, per a CNBC article.

title: Bank ETFs in Focus on Consumer vs Corporate Tug-of-War in Q2
text: Resilient consumers but a cautious corporate behavior pulled the strings on banking earnings in the second quarter.

title: Factbox: U.S. banks increase reserves for commercial real estate exposure
text: The U.S. commercial property market has faced severe challenges since the pandemic due to lingering office vacancies, diminished retail activity and higher interest rates. That stress has caused banks and other lenders to tighten their standards for new loans and scrutinize existing ones.

title: 5 Picks to Tap Dow's Longest Winning Streak Since 2017
text: Investors seeking to participate in Dow Jones' longest winning streak since 2017 may consider top-ranked stocks like JPMorgan (JPM), Salesforce (CRM), Caterpillar (CAT), McDonald's (MCD) and Honeywell (HON).

title: Wall Street's most AI-enthusiastic bank delivers machine-generated research notes
text: JPMorgan Chase & Co., the largest U.S. bank, has been wading into artificial intelligence to a greater extent than its rivals and is now producing a series of research notes that are AI-generated.The move represents something of a step forward in an area that's been seen as ripe for disruption — investment research — at a time when the AI revolution is taking hold on Wall Street. At JPMorgan, AI is being used to create short summaries of human-produced reports and then link those reports inside the firm's Cross Asset Spotlight.

title: 11 Stocks Drive The Dow's Amazing 10-Straight Day Rally
text: The Dow's 10-straight day rally keeps making history — it hasn't done this since at least 2017. And investors can thank a select group.

title: Private-equity mogul Leon Black agreed to pay $62.5 million to settle Epstein-related claims: report
text: Leon Black, founder of private-equity giant Apollo Global Management, agreed to pay $62.5 million to the U.S. Virgin Islands earlier this year to be free from any potential claims arising from the territory's three-year investigation into the sex trafficking crimes of the late disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein, according to a Friday report.

title: 5 Picks to Tap Dow's Longest Winning Streak Since 2017
text: After lagging the S&P 500 and Nasdaq for most of the year, the Dow Jones Industrial Average is finally making a comeback.

title: Term of the Week: Net Interest Income
text: Higher interest rates boosted big banks' net interest income in the second quarter, which is the profit banks earn from charging higher interest rates to borrowers than they pay out to depositors and account holders.

title: 3 Warren Buffett Stocks With Yields Above 4%
text: Warren Buffett's portfolio contains a few high-yield stocks, mainly in the financial sector. Buffett also owns one high-yield food brand. Most of the stocks in Buffett's portfolio pay dividends, but few have high yields.

title: Avoiding Recession, Cooling Inflation, AI Plays And Financial Earnings With Victor Dergunov
text: A 25 basis point increase from the Federal Reserve is expected and likely already priced into the market. Inflation has been decreasing, potentially opening the door for a more relaxed monetary stance from the Fed, possibly leading to lower interest rates in 2024.

title: JPMorgan Chase: Stick With The Best
text: JPMorgan competes at an elite level in consumer and business banking, investment banking, and asset/wealth management. The company has been resilient in the face of the banking crisis earlier this year. We believe JPM stock is the strongest US bank and is trading at an attractive level for long-term investors.

title: Market Rally Broadens Out: Banking Giant Hits 52-Week High
text: We've heard all year how the rally was being driven solely by big tech, but recent expansion suggests otherwise.

text: JPMorgan's stock (NYSE: JPM) has gained 16% YTD, as compared to the 18% rise in the S&P500 over the same period.

title: 15 value-stock picks for momentum investors from a money manager who has outperformed the S&P 500 for 30 years
text: During the first five months of 2023, there were investors who had difficulty believing in a sustained stock-market rally because the action was dominated by the largest technology companies. But the breadth of participation in the rally has expanded since then.

title: Leon Black refused to answer questions about his financial dealings with Jeffrey Epstein, Senate committee says as it unveils tax probe
text: The Senate Finance Committee has been conducting an investigation for more than a year into the tax implications of billionaire and Apollo Global Management Inc. co-founder Leon Black's ties to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, Sen. Ron Wyden said Tuesday.

title: Chase Bank outage leads to interruptions for Zelle payment network
text: An unexplained outage at Chase Bank has led to interruptions for users of the Zelle payment network, who took to social media to complain.

title: LVMH results were good, but not good enough
text: Luxury goods giant LVMH's interim results released after the Tuesday closing bell were “solid, but not solid enough”, according to equities analysts at JPMorgan Chase & Co (NYSE:JPM). Analysts noted a low-single-digit miss on profits, while a robust 21% growth in the fashion and leather goods segment was nonetheless below investors' mid-20s expectations.

title: JPMorgan to buy almost $2 bln of mortgages in the PacWest deal - Bloomberg News
text: JPMorgan Chase & Co will buy almost $2 billion worth of mortgages to facilitate Banc of California's purchase of PacWest Bancorp , Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday.

title: Seeking Stability? 3 Top-Ranked Large-Caps to Buy
text: While small-caps may boast explosive growth characteristics, the stability of large-caps attracts many. And recently, analysts have become bullish on these three.

title: 3 Top Blue Chip Stocks to Ride the Dow Rally
text: As the Dow continues to scale upward, it's prudent to invest in stocks such as JPMorgan (JPM), Walmart (WMT) and Johnson & Johnson (JNJ) that are listed on the said index and are financially sound.

title: 3 Companies That Could Be Worth $1 Trillion by 2030
text: There are currently five companies on U.S. stock exchanges with market caps of $1 trillion or more. There are dozens of companies within striking distance, but I feel that these three have an excellent chance of reaching the $1 trillion level by the end of the decade.
